name: Metoprolol Tartrate
indications: metoprolol tartrate tablets beta-adrenergic blocker indicated treatment : • hypertension , lower blood pressure . lowering blood pressure reduces risk fatal non-fatal cardiovascular events , primarily strokes myocardial infarctions . ( 1.1 ) • angina pectoris . ( 1.2 ) • myocardial infarction , reduce risk cardiovascular mortality used conjunction intravenous metoprolol therapy patients definite suspected acute myocardial infarction hemodynamically stable patients . ( 1.3 )
contraindications: • administer daily food meal . titrate weekly longer intervals needed tolerated . ( 2 ) • hypertension : recommended starting 100 mg daily , single divided doses . ( 2.1 ) • angina pectoris : recommended starting 100 mg daily , given two divided doses . ( 2.2 ) • myocardial infarction : starting depends upon tolerance intravenous metoprolol , full prescribing information . ( 2.3 )
warningsAndPrecautions: metoprolol tartrate tablets , usp available follows : tablets 50 mg – light pink , round , film coated tablet debossed `` m/1 `` bisect one side plain side . bottles 30 ndc 82804-978-30 bottles 60 ndc 82804-978-60 bottles 90 ndc 82804-978-90 bottles 100 ndc 82804-978-00 bottles 500 ndc 82804-978-55 bottles 1000 ndc 82804-978-11 tablets 100 mg – light blue , round , film coated tablet debossed `` m/2 `` bisect one side plain side . bottles 30 ndc 82804-979-30 bottles 60 ndc 82804-979-60 bottles 90 ndc 82804-979-90 bottles 100 ndc 82804-979-00 bottles 500 ndc 82804-979-55 bottles 1000 ndc 82804-979-11
adverseReactions: metoprolol tartrate contraindicated severe bradycardia , second- third-degree heart block , cardiogenic shock , systolic blood pressure < 100 , decompensated heart failure , sick sinus syndrome ( unless permanent pacemaker place ) , patients hypersensitive component product .
indications_original: Metoprolol tartrate tablets is a beta-adrenergic blocker indicated for the treatment of: • Hypertension, to lower blood pressure. Lowering blood pressure reduces the risk of fatal and non-fatal cardiovascular events, primarily strokes and myocardial infarctions. ( 1.1 ) • Angina Pectoris. ( 1.2 ) • Myocardial Infarction, to reduce the risk of cardiovascular mortality when used in conjunction with intravenous metoprolol therapy in patients with definite or suspected acute myocardial infarction in hemodynamically stable patients. ( 1.3 )
contraindications_original: • Administer once daily with food or after a meal. Titrate at weekly or longer intervals as needed and tolerated. ( 2 ) • Hypertension: Recommended starting dosage is 100 mg daily, in single or divided doses. ( 2.1 ) • Angina Pectoris: Recommended starting dosage is 100 mg daily, given as two divided doses. ( 2.2 ) • Myocardial Infarction: The starting dosage depends upon tolerance of intravenous metoprolol, see full prescribing information. ( 2.3 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Metoprolol Tartrate Tablets, USP are available as follows:
                  
                     Tablets 50 mg – Light pink, round, film coated tablet debossed "M/1" with bisect on one side and plain on the other side.

adverseReactions_original: Metoprolol tartrate is contraindicated in severe bradycardia, second- or third-degree heart block, cardiogenic shock, systolic blood pressure <100, decompensated heart failure, sick sinus syndrome (unless a permanent pacemaker is in place), and in patients who are hypersensitive to any component of this product.
